alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 17 at 7:34PM MST until July 17 at 11:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Arizona, including the following county, Yavapai. * WHEN...Until 145 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 734 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.75 and 1.75 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Larry Creek, Wolf Creek, Crazy Basin Creek, Castle Creek, North Fork Rock Creek, Mineral Creek, Rock Creek, Squaw Creek, Tank Creek, Badger Spring Wash, Black Canyon, Poland Creek, Antelope Creek, Sycamore Creek, Big Bug Creek, Agua Fria River, Slate Creek, Government Spring Wash, Hackberry Creek, Black Canyon Creek, Turkey Creek and Cedar Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bumble Bee, Cordes, Cordes Lakes, Cordes Junction, Spring Valley and Mayer. - This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 264 and 271. Interstate 17 between mile markers 243 and 262. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
